Detailed Description

List of events for Bitcloud(tm) events facility.

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com
Support email: support@microchip.com

Copyright (c) 2018, Microchip Corporation. All rights reserved. Licensed under Mirochip's Limited License Agreement.

Definition in file sysEvents.h.

Define Documentation

#define BC_MATCH_DESCR_REQ_ACTION   (1U << 0)

The list of stack actions for which it is necessary to request permissions. Receiving of the Match_Desc_req (ClusterId = 0x0006). See ZigBee spec. r19, 2.4.3.1.7, page 106. The context field contains pointer to the APS_DataInd_t structure of the Match_Desc_req.

Definition at line 35 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_BIND_REQ_ACTION   (1U << 1)

Receiving of the Bind_req (ClusterId = 0x0021). See ZigBee spec. r19, 2.4.3.2.2, page 126. The context field contains pointer to the APS_DataInd_t structure of the Bind_req.

Definition at line 39 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_UNBIND_REQ_ACTION   (1U << 2)

Receiving of the Unbind_req (ClusterId = 0x0022). See ZigBee spec. r19, 2.4.3.2.3, page 128. The context field contains pointer to the APS_DataInd_t structure of the Unbind_req.

Definition at line 43 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_UPDATE_DEVICE_REQ_ACTION   (1U << 3)

Receiving and handling of the APS Update Device command. See ZigBee spec. r19, 4.4.9.3, page 481. The context field contains pointer to the aligned extended address of an joined device.

Definition at line 47 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_BEACON_FILTERING_ACTION   (1U << 4)

Received beacon passed for custom filtering. The context field contains pointer to the MAC_BeaconNotifyInd_t structure

Definition at line 50 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_CHILD_NWK_ADDR_ALLOC_ACTION   (1U << 5)

Child request for address allocation during the join procedure appeared. The context field keeps a proposed NWK address

Definition at line 53 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_FRAME_FILTERING_BY_PROFILE_ID_ACTION   (1U << 6)

Received frame with ProfileId different from one, used by destination endpoint. The context field keeps a structure of pointer to destination endpoint and conflicting ProfileId

Definition at line 57 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_POLL_FAILED_ACTION   (1U << 7)

Parent poll procedure failed. The context field keeps an amount of consequential fails.

Definition at line 60 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_TRANSPORT_NWK_KEY_ACTION   (1U << 8)

Received Transport key with nwk key. Whether to accept the key or not can be decided by subscriber using the given keyhandle and src address

Definition at line 63 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_UPDATE_DEVICE_IND_ACTION   (1U << 9)

Received Update Device Indication at Trust Center

Definition at line 65 of file sysEvents.h.

Received Request Key Indication at Trust Center

Received Verify Key Indication at Trust Center

Definition at line 69 of file sysEvents.h.

#define BC_VERIFY_KEY_REQ_ATTTEMPS_ACTION   (1U <<12)

To check Verify Req attempts are done

Definition at line 71 of file sysEvents.h.

#define ZCL_ACTION_WRITE_ATTR_REQUEST   (1U << 0)

The list of ZCL actions to be handled in the respective clusters

Definition at line 74 of file sysEvents.h.

Typedef Documentation

typedef enum _BcEvents_t BcEvents_t

Identifiers of the evetns used by the stack. The SYS_SubscribeToEvent() function may be used to add handler functions for these events.

An event may be provided with context information known as the event's data. Event's data is provided in the second argument of a callback function subscribed to the event (see SYS_EventReceiver_t::func). The argument is of the SYS_EventData_t type. If event's data is one- or two-bytes long it is copied into the argument. Otherwise, the argument contains the pointer to the type holding event's data and should be casted to this pointer type.

typedef uint16_t BcAction_t

Type of an external action. For example, receiving of a Mgmt-Bind.request command. Actions can be combined using the OR operand.

Definition at line 374 of file sysEvents.h.

typedef struct _BcAccessReq_t BcAccessReq_t

Type of data which is passed as the data parameter into an event handler of the BC_EVENT_ACCESS_REQUEST event. An initiator must initialize all fields of the structure before calling of the SYS_PostEvent() function.

typedef uint16_t BcZCLAction_t

Type of an ZCL external action. For example, receiving of a write attribute request command. Actions can be combined using the OR operand.

Definition at line 392 of file sysEvents.h.

typedef struct _BcZCLActionReq_t BcZCLActionReq_t

Type of data which is passed as the data parameter into an event handler of the BC_ZCL_EVENT_ACTION_REQUEST event. An initiator must initialize all fields of the structure before calling of the SYS_PostEvent() function.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum System_Clock_Config

Configuring various states of system.

Used for initializing various system clock states

Enumerator:
INITIALIZING_WAKE_UP_STATE 

system clock state during wakeup

INITIALIZING_SLEEP_STATE 

system clock state while initiating sleep

RF_INITIALIZED 

system clock state during system init

SWITCH_TO_RC_INTERNAL 

system clock switch to RC_INTERNAL from CLKM

Definition at line 84 of file sysEvents.h.

enum _BcEvents_t

Identifiers of the evetns used by the stack. The SYS_SubscribeToEvent() function may be used to add handler functions for these events.

An event may be provided with context information known as the event's data. Event's data is provided in the second argument of a callback function subscribed to the event (see SYS_EventReceiver_t::func). The argument is of the SYS_EventData_t type. If event's data is one- or two-bytes long it is copied into the argument. Otherwise, the argument contains the pointer to the type holding event's data and should be casted to this pointer type.

Enumerator:
BC_EVENT_NETWORK_LOST 

Connection to the network has been lost. Event's data is null.

BC_EVENT_TC_OFFLINE 

Connection to the trust center has been lost. Event's data is null.

BC_EVENT_CHILD_JOINED 

A new child has joined the network through the own node. Event's data: ChildInfo_t; provides information about the new node.

BC_EVENT_CHILD_REMOVED 

A child node has left the network. Event's data: ChildInfo_t; only the ChildInfo_t::extAddr field is set - with the child's extended address.

BC_EVENT_NETWORK_LEFT 

Network has been left by the own node. Event's data is null.

BC_EVENT_NETWORK_STARTED 

Network has been rejoined. Event's data is null.

BC_EVENT_NETWORK_UPDATE 

Some network parameters (network address, PANID, or the working channel) have been changed. Event's data is null.

BC_EVENT_CHILD_KEY_ABSENT 

Security keys for the joining device have not been found. Event's data: ChildInfo_t; provides information about the joining device.

BC_EVENT_ADDRESS_CONFLICT 

A conflict of static short addresses has occured. Event's data: ShortAddr_t; ----- contains the conflicting address.

BC_EVENT_KEY_PAIR_DELETED 

An APS key-pair set's entry has been removed. Event's data: ExtAddr_t; contains the extended address from the removed entry.

BC_EVENT_NEW_CONCENTRATOR 

A new concentrator has been discovered (many-to-one routing). ---- Event's data: NwkRoutingEntryIndex_t - an index in the routing table.

BC_EVENT_DEVICE_ANNCE 

A device announcement has been received. Event's data: ExtAddr_t; the address of the announced node.

BC_EVENT_UPDATE_LINK_KEY 

The link key has been updated as a result of key establishment. Event's data: ExtAddr_t; the extended address of the device which link key has been updated.

BC_EVENT_DEVICE_LEFT 

The event is raised on the trust center when a remote device leaves the network. Event's data: ExtAddr_t; the extended address of the device that leaves the network.

BC_EVENT_NETWORK_ENTERED 

The node has started or joined the network. Event's data is null.

BC_EVENT_STORING_FINISHED 

An operation of writing to persistent memory performed by PDS has completed. Event's data is null.

BC_EVENT_BIND_TABLE_UPDATED 

An entry has been added to or removed from the APS binding table. Event's data is null.

BC_EVENT_GROUP_TABLE_UPDATED 

A group has been added to or removed from the NWK group table. ---- Event's data: NWK_GroupAddr_t; the group's address.

BC_EVENT_GROUPS_REMOVED 

A group has been removed from the NWK group table. Event's data is NWK_GroupTableEntry_t.

BC_EVENT_PERMISSION_TABLE_UPDATED 

Permissions for a given node have been changed. Event's data: ExtAddr_t; the extended address of the affected node.

BC_EVENT_NWK_SECURITY_TABLES_UPDATED 

NWK security table (holding network keys) has been updated. ------ Event's data: NwkKeyIndex_t; the index of the updated network key entry.

BC_EVENT_APS_SECURITY_TABLES_UPDATED 

APS key-pair set has been updated. Event's data: APS_KeyHandle_t; the handle of the updated entry.

BC_EVENT_KE_CLUSTER_MATCH_DESC_RESP 

A response for a match descriptor request sent during key establishment to discover devices supporting the KE cluster has been received. Event's data: ZDO_ZdpResp_t; the match descriptor response data.

BC_EVENT_KE_CLUSTER_INITIATE_KE_REQ 

The initiate key establishment request command has been sent. Event's data: ZCL_InitiateKeyEstablishmentCommand_t; the command's payload.

BC_EVENT_KE_CLUSTER_INITIATE_KE_RESP 

The initiate key establishment response command has been sent. Event's data: ZCL_InitiateKeyEstablishmentCommand_t; the command's payload.

BC_EVENT_KE_CLUSTER_EPH_DATA_REQ 

The ephemeral data request command has been received. Event's data: ZCL_EphemeralDataCommand_t; the command's payload.

BC_EVENT_KE_CLUSTER_EPH_DATA_RESP 

The ephemeral data response command has been received. Event's data: ZCL_EphemeralDataCommand_t; the command's payload.

BC_EVENT_KE_CLUSTER_CONF_KEY_REQ 

The key data request command has been received. Event's data: ZCL_ConfirmKeyCommand_t; the command's payload.

BC_EVENT_KE_CLUSTER_CONF_KEY_RESP 

The key data response command has been received. Event's data: ZCL_ConfirmKeyCommand_t; the command's payload.

BC_EVENT_KE_CLUSTER_TERMINATE_CMD 

The KE terminate command has been received. Event's data: ZCL_TKEStatus_t; the status code received with the command.

BC_EVENT_ACCESS_REQUEST 

A request for which persmissions may be set has been received. Event's data: BcAccessReq_t; the context differs depending on the request's type.

BC_SECURITY_NWK_COUNTERS_UPDATE 

NWK security counters have to be saved to PDS

BC_SECURITY_APS_COUNTERS_UPDATE 

APS security counters have to be saved to PDS

BC_EVENT_RX_ZDP_COMMAND 

ZDP command is received.

BC_EVENT_NWK_UPDATEID_CHANGED 

Event on NWK updateId changing

BC_EVENT_TC_MODE_CHANGED 

Event on TC mode changing

BC_EVENT_CHANNEL_CHANGED 

Event on NWK channel changing

BC_EVENT_BUSY_REQUEST 

The stack raises this event when it tries to go to sleep mode. Any layers or application, that is subscribed to this event, may set passed data to false to prevent stack from going to sleep mode. Event's data: bool.

BC_EVENT_NWK_RREQ_ID_UPDATED 

Top part of route request id is updated.

BC_ZDP_REQUEST_RECEIVED 

ZDP request was received

BC_ZDP_RESPONSE_RECEIVED 

ZDP response was received

BC_ZDP_DEVICE_ANNOUNCE_RECEIVED 

ZDP message was received

BC_ZDP_JOIN_PERMITTED_CHANGED 

ZDP device annce was received

SYS_EVENT_TASK_PROCESSED 

Task processing completed

HAL_EVENT_FALLING_ASLEEP 

Device is entering sleep mode

HAL_EVENT_WAKING_UP 

Device is waking up from sleep mode

BC_EVENT_MAX_SLEEP_TIME_REQUEST 

A request for maximum time that device can sleep before active state is required

HAL_EVENT_CONTINUING_SLEEP 

Device woke up for timer reload and is continuing sleep mode

BC_EVENT_NV_MEMORY_SECURITY_COMPROMISED 

Secured parameter was modified inside the NV Storage

BC_EVENT_PARENT_LINK_FAILURE 

Parent link failure has been detected.

BC_ZSI_LOST_SYNCHRONIZATION 

Connection to ZSI device on over side has been lost.

BC_EVENT_BAD_FRAME_COUNTER 

A conflict of incoming frame counters has occured. Event's data: ShortAddr_t; - contains the address device with failed counter.

BC_EVENT_REMOVE_DEVICE_RECEIVED 

Remove Device is received from TC

BC_EVENT_LEAVE_COMMAND_RECEIVED 

ZDP Mgmt or NWK Leave command is received from parent with rejoin false

BC_EVENT_FRAME_SECURITY_FAILED 

Couldn't obtain security material for incoming frame. Event's data: ShortAddr_t; - contains the address device with failed counter.

BC_EVENT_ADDRESS_CONFLICT_RESOLVING_ALLOWED 

Device is in network already, allow address conflict resolving

BC_EVENT_POLL_REQUEST 

This event is raised only if SLEEP_WHEN_IDLE feature is enabled. The stack raises this event when it checks whether polling should be turned on or not for end device. Any layers or application, that is subscribed to this event, may set passed data to true if polling is required. That allows to make an end device sleep when it wait fir some response from its parent and wake up every CS_POLL_PERIOD ms to poll its parent. Event's data: bool.

BC_EVENT_CHILD_ASSOCIATED 

A device has associated with this device. This event is called just after the network key is sent to the child. This is NOT an indication that the child has successfully joined the network!

BC_ZCL_EVENT_ACTION_REQUEST 

This event indicates the cluster about ZCL cluster specific events

BC_EVENT_APS_DATA_INDICATION 

This event indicates that an APS layer data has been received

BC_EVENT_NWK_DATA_CONFIRM 

This event indicates that an NWK layer data confirm has been received

BC_EVENT_MAC_TX_SUCCESS 

This event indicates the successfull data transmission at MAC layer

BC_EVENT_SOURCE_ROUTING_STATUS_INDICATION 

This event indicates that a route record command or a network Status command is received with source route failed or many-to-one route failed status

BC_EVENT_PHY_INIT 

This event indicates the successfull initialization of the tranceiver

BC_EVENT_NWK_SECURITY_FRAME_COUNTER_EXCEED_THRESHOLD 

Outgoing Frame Counter reaches 0xFF000000

BC_EVENT_TCLK_VERIFICATION_DONE 

TCLK Verifucation Done

BC_EVENT_TC_ACCESS_REQUEST 

This event indicates the cluster about trust center specific events Event's data: BcAccessReq_t; the context differs depending on the request's type.

BC_EVENT_APS_TX_UCAST_RETRY 

This event indicates APS layer retries of a unicast

BC_EVENT_APS_BCAST_DATA_INDICATION 

This event indicates APS layer Tx/Rx broadcast

BC_EVENT_ROUTE_DISC_INITIATED 

This event indicates a route dicovery has been initiated

BC_EVENT_PACKET_BUFFER_ALLOCATE_FAIL 

This event indicates a packet buffer allocation failed

BC_EVENT_ZGPH_INDICATION 

This event is triggered from high ZGP on successful commissioning, on receiving gpPairingConfig/gpSinkCommissioningModeReq/GPDF cmd/cluster commands

BC_EVENT_ZGPL_GPDF_INDICATION 

This event is triggered from low ZGP on receicing GPDF

BC_EVENT_ZGPL_GPDF_TX_CONFIRM 

This event is triggered from ZGP on successful commissioning, on receiving gpPairingConfig/gpSinkCommissioningModeReq/GPDF data

BC_EVENT_NWK_ADD_NEIGHBOR 

This event indicates a neighbor is added to the neighbor table

BC_EVENT_NWK_REMOVE_NEIGHBOR 

This event indicates a neighbor entry is removed from the neighbor table

BC_EVENT_NWK_STALE_NEIGHBOR 

This event indicates that a neighbor entry has become stale

BC_EVENT_UPGRADE_STRUCT_CHANGED_ITEMS 

Tis event isused to upgrade the 4.0 structure changes in the SNV

BC_EVENT_APS_RX_UCAST 

This event indicates reception of a unicast packet at APS layer

BC_EVENT_APS_TX_UCAST_SUCCESS 

This event indicates successful unicast data transmission at APS layer

BC_EVENT_MAC_RX_UCAST 

This event indicates reception of a unicast packet at MAC layer

BC_EVENT_MAC_TX_UCAST 

This event indicates unicast data transmission at MAC layer

BC_EVENT_MAC_TX_UCAST_FAIL 

This event indicates that a failed unicast data transmission at MAC layer

BC_EVENT_MAC_RX_BCAST 

This event indicates reception of a broadcast packet at MAC layer

BC_EVENT_MAC_TX_BCAST 

This event indicates broadcast data transmission at MAC layer

BC_EVENT_NWK_REJOIN_IND_SUCCESS 

This event indicates MAC layer that a sucessful rejoin request has been received, and hence clear any pending data to be transmitted for that particular endDevice.

BC_EVENT_MAC_TX_BCAST_CH_ACCESS_FAIL 

This event indicates broadcast data transmission fail due to the channelAccess failure at MAC layer

BC_EVENT_ZGPH_TRANS_TABLE_INDICATION 

This event is triggered from low ZGP on receicing GPDF

BC_EVENT_VALIDATE_ZDP_REQUEST 

This event is triggered from Zdo when an incoming malformed req frame is rejected

BC_EVENT_VALIDATE_ZDP_RESPONSE 

This event is triggered from Zdo when an incoming malformed resp frame is rejected
